compounddef.title: Miscenalleous: logs, version strings, config storage

detaileddescription.para: No response received from remote
Authentication failed due to bad
The call has been declined
Destination of the calls was not found.
The call was not answered in time
Phone line was busy
Unsupported content
Transport error: connection failures, disconnections etc...
Do not disturb reason
Operation is unauthorized because missing credential
Operation like call update rejected by peer
Operation could not be executed by server or remote client because it didn't have any context for it

Enum describing various failure reasons or contextual information for some events.
linphone_call_get_reason()
linphone_proxy_config_get_error()
Alias to the LinphoneContent struct.
Enum describing failure reasons.
The LpConfig object is used to manipulate a configuration file.

The format of the configuration file is a .ini like format:
sections are defined in []
each section contains a sequence of key=value pairs.

Example: [sound] echocanceler=1 playback_dev=ALSA:Defaultdevice
[video] enabled=1
Enable logs in supplied FILE*.

parameterdescription.para: a C FILE* where to fprintf logs. If null stdout is used.

detaileddescription.para: Enable logs through the user's supplied log callback.

parameterdescription.para: The address of a OrtpLogFunc callback whose protoype is typedef void (*OrtpLogFunc)(OrtpLogLevel lev, const char *fmt, va_list args);

detaileddescription.para: Entirely disable logging.
Returns liblinphone's version as a string.
Sets the user agent string used in SIP messages.
Returns the LpConfig object used to manage the storage (config) file.
The application can use the LpConfig object to insert its own private sections and pairs of key=value in the configuration file.
Converts a LinphoneReason enum to a string.

Converts a config section into a dictionary.
a #LinphoneDictionary with all the keys from a section, or NULL if the section doesn't exist
Loads a dictionary into a section of the lpconfig. If the section doesn't exist it is created. Overwrites existing keys, creates non-existing keys.
Define a log handler.

parameterdescription.para: The function pointer of the log handler.

detaileddescription.para: Define a log file.
If the file pointer passed as an argument is NULL, stdout is used instead.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the FILE structure of the file to write to.

detaileddescription.para: Define the log level.
The loglevel parameter is a bitmask parameter. Therefore to enable only warning and error messages, use ORTP_WARNING | ORTP_ERROR. To disable logs, simply set loglevel to 0.

parameterdescription.para: A bitmask of the log levels to set.

detaileddescription.para:
Create a LpConfig object from a user config file.
lc
LinphoneCore object
filename
The filename of the config file to read to fill the instantiated LpConfig

*Function to get call country code from ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code, ex: FR returns 33
iso
country code alpha2
call country code or -1 if not found

*Function to get call country code from an e164 number, ex: +33952650121 will return 33
e164
phone number
call country code or -1 if not found
Instantiates a LpConfig object from a user config file.

parameterdescription.para: the filename of the config file to read to fill the instantiated LpConfig

detaileddescription.para: Instantiates a LpConfig object from a user config file and a factory config file.

config_filename
the filename of the user config file to read to fill the instantiated LpConfig
factory_config_filename
the filename of the factory config file to read to fill the instantiated LpConfig
lp_config_new The user config file is read first to fill the LpConfig and then the factory config file is read. Therefore the configuration parameters defined in the user config file will be overwritten by the parameters defined in the factory config file.
Reads a user config file and fill the LpConfig with the read config values.

parameterdescription.para: The LpConfig object to fill with the content of the file
The filename of the config file to read to fill the LpConfig

memberdef.argsstring: (const LpConfig *lpconfig, const char *section, const char *key, const char *default_string)
memberdef.name: lp_config_get_string

detaileddescription.para: Retrieves a configuration item as a string, given its section, key, and default value.
The default value string is returned if the config item isn't found.

memberdef.argsstring: (const LpConfig *lpconfig, const char *section, const char *key, int *min, int *max, int default_min, int default_max)
memberdef.name: lp_config_get_range

detaileddescription.para: Retrieves a configuration item as a range, given its section, key, and default min and max values.

simplesect.para: TRUE if the value is successfully parsed as a range, FALSE otherwise. If FALSE is returned, min and max are filled respectively with default_min and default_max values.

memberdef.argsstring: (const LpConfig *lpconfig, const char *section, const char *key, int default_value)
memberdef.name: lp_config_get_int

detaileddescription.para: Retrieves a configuration item as an integer, given its section, key, and default value.
The default integer value is returned if the config item isn't found.

memberdef.argsstring: (const LpConfig *lpconfig, const char *section, const char *key, int64_t default_value)
memberdef.name: lp_config_get_int64

detaileddescription.para: Retrieves a configuration item as a 64 bit integer, given its section, key, and default value.
The default integer value is returned if the config item isn't found.

memberdef.argsstring: (const LpConfig *lpconfig, const char *section, const char *key, float default_value)
memberdef.name: lp_config_get_float

detaileddescription.para: Retrieves a configuration item as a float, given its section, key, and default value.
The default float value is returned if the config item isn't found.

memberdef.argsstring: (LpConfig *lpconfig, const char *section, const char *key, const char *value)
memberdef.name: lp_config_set_string

detaileddescription.para: Sets a string config item

memberdef.argsstring: (LpConfig *lpconfig, const char *section, const char *key, int min_value, int max_value)
memberdef.name: lp_config_set_range

detaileddescription.para: Sets a range config item

memberdef.argsstring: (LpConfig *lpconfig, const char *section, const char *key, int value)
memberdef.name: lp_config_set_int

detaileddescription.para: Sets an integer config item

memberdef.argsstring: (LpConfig *lpconfig, const char *section, const char *key, int value)
memberdef.name: lp_config_set_int_hex

detaileddescription.para: Sets an integer config item, but store it as hexadecimal

memberdef.argsstring: (LpConfig *lpconfig, const char *section, const char *key, int64_t value)
memberdef.name: lp_config_set_int64

detaileddescription.para: Sets a 64 bits integer config item

memberdef.argsstring: (LpConfig *lpconfig, const char *section, const char *key, float value)
memberdef.name: lp_config_set_float

detaileddescription.para: Sets a float config item
Writes the config file to disk.
Returns 1 if a given section is present in the configuration.
Removes every pair of key,value in a section and remove the section.
Call a function for each section present in the configuration.

memberdef.argsstring: (const LpConfig *lpconfig, const char *section, void(*callback)(const char *entry, void *ctx), void *ctx)
memberdef.name: lp_config_for_each_entry

detaileddescription.para: Call a function for each entry present in a section configuration.
